summary: The French Revolution (1789â€“1799) was a time of big changes in France. It started because people were unhappy with the old government and there were money problems. The Estates General turned into a National Assembly, and they made important changes like ending feudalism. There were fights for power and economic struggles. After war losses, the monarchy ended, and King Louis XVI was killed. A group called the Committee of Public Safety took over, and they executed many people. Later, a new government called the Directory was formed, then replaced by Napoleon Bonaparte in a coup.
title: French Revolution
